column4: yeah, so dd'ing a .dmg onto a usb stick under macos x doesn't result in something bootable...
because dmgs are OSX only, typically.
well, I converted the ubuntu netbook iso to a dmg using hdiutil
as per the instructions on the ubuntu web site.. :-)
https://help.ubuntu.com/community/Installation/FromImgFiles#Mac%20OS%20X ?
yeah, that...no joy
that guide does not reference hdiutil.
also the mac section of https://help.ubuntu.com/community/Installation/FromUSBStick
well, hdiutil is how you make the .img in the first place
yeah, sure enough it isn't marked as bootable for some reason
what are you attempting to install *to*?
HP mini 110....I've done it this way before, I just can't seem to remember how I made the USB stick
use an existing Ubuntu system, or Windows?
if I had any of those things, I would use them
worst case, boot OSX from a live CD and use the Ubuntu enviorn there.
I think I'll probably resort to booting a vmware VM from a live ISO before I do that.. :-)
*boot your mac
I have my dell m1330 dual-booting OS X and Ubuntu, so I'm personally happy. Wifi and ethernet don't work, though. :P
wow, even the wired ethernet doesn't work?  :-(
Intel card, I think. I had to resort to a USB-eth adapter.
that sucks
phooey, vmware it is, it seems...
I've devolved to using unetbootin in a VM...lets see how well that worked...
